title: 112_hr6100
content: The Act titled "Middle Class Tax Cut Protection Act of 2012" extends tax relief for the middle class for 2 years. The Middle Class Tax Cut Protection Act of 2012 extends tax relief provisions from 2001 and 2003, pushing the expiration date to December 31, 2014. Additionally, temporary tax relief from 2009 is also extended. The Middle Class Tax Cut Protection Act of 2012 extends tax relief provisions from 2001 and 2003 until December 31, 2014, and also extends temporary tax relief from 2009. This includes amendments to various tax credits for the years 2012, 2013, and 2014. The Middle Class Tax Cut Protection Act of 2012 extends tax relief provisions until December 31, 2014, including amendments to the earned income tax credit for the years 2012, 2013, and 2014. SEC. 3. Certain tax cuts not extended for high-income individuals. Individual Income Tax Rates amended to include a new 33-percent rate bracket for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2012. The rate of tax for the fourth rate bracket and higher brackets will be 33 percent. The new tax law introduces a 36-percent rate of tax for taxable income exceeding a certain threshold, with the applicable amount being the excess of the applicable threshold over the basic standard deduction. The new tax law sets a 36-percent tax rate for income above a specific threshold, calculated as the excess over the standard deduction and exemption amounts. The applicable threshold varies based on the subsection, with $250,000 for subsection (a) and $200,000 for subsections (b) and (c). The tax law establishes a 36-percent rate for income exceeding certain thresholds. The fourth rate bracket is defined as the 36-percent bracket without adjustments. An inflation adjustment rule applies for taxable years after 2012. The tax law modifies rates for income exceeding thresholds, with a 36-percent bracket and inflation adjustments post-2012. Amendments include changes to subparagraphs and new criteria for determining taxable income. The tax law modifies rates for income exceeding thresholds, with a 36-percent bracket and inflation adjustments post-2012. Amendments include changes to subparagraphs and new criteria for determining taxable income. The amendment specifies the calculation of tax on adjusted net capital gain and dividends under section 1(h)(11) of the Code. The tax law amendments include changes to rates for income exceeding thresholds, with a 36-percent bracket and inflation adjustments post-2012. It specifies the calculation of tax on adjusted net capital gain and dividends under section 1(h)(11) of the Code. The tax law amendments increase the rate to 20 percent for adjusted net capital gain exceeding certain amounts. Various provisions are amended to reflect this change. The tax law amendments increase the rate to 20 percent for adjusted net capital gain exceeding certain amounts, effective for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2012. Withholding amendments apply to amounts paid on or after January 1, 2013.
